snippet: A sweeping new ethics bill would also require disclosures by thousands of employees in the executive branch.
abstract: Senate passes a sweeping new ethics bill that would ban insider trading by members of Congress and require prompt disclosure of stock transactions by lawmakers and thousands of officials in the executive branch of government; vote follows three days of impassioned debate in which senators tried to outdo one another in proclaiming their support for ethics in government.
lead_paragraph: A sweeping new ethics bill would also require disclosures by thousands of employees in the executive branch.

headline.main: Senate Approves Ban on Insider Trading by Congress
headline.print_headline: By 96 to 3, Senate Approves Ban on Insider Trading by Members of Congress
